inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id to which the query refers

outputs.name: price

inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id to which the query refers

inputs.name: addrAdverFinance
inputs.description: Address of the new Advertisement Finance contract

abiDocs.name: upgradeFinance
abiDocs.details: This function is part of the upgrade mechanism avaliable to the advertisement contracts. Using this function it is possible to update to a new Advertisement Finance contract without  the need to cancel avaliable campaigns. Upgrade finance function can only be called by the Advertisement contract owner.
abiDocs.notice: Upgrade finance contract used by this contract

abiDocs.name: getAdvertisementStorageAddress

outputs.name: storageContract
outputs.description: Address of the Advertisement Storage contract used by this contract

abiDocs.details: This function is required to upgrade Advertisement contract address on Advertisement  Finance contract. This function can only be called by the Advertisement Finance  contract registered in this contract.
abiDocs.return: { "storageContract" : "Address of the Advertisement Storage contract used by this contract" }
abiDocs.notice: Get Advertisement Storage Address used by this contract

inputs.name: addrAdverStorage
inputs.description: Address of the new Advertisement Storage contract

abiDocs.name: upgradeStorage
abiDocs.details: Upgrades Advertisement Storage contract addres with no need to redeploy Advertisement contract. However every campaign in the old contract will be canceled.  This function can only be called by the Advertisement contract owner.
abiDocs.notice: Upgrade storage contract used by this contract

inputs.name: packageName
inputs.description: Package name of the appication subject to the user aquisition campaign

inputs.name: countries
inputs.description: Encoded list of 3 integers intended to include every  county where this campaign will be avaliable. For more detain on this encoding refer to wiki documentation.

inputs.name: vercodes
inputs.description: List of version codes to which the user aquisition campaign is applied.

inputs.name: price
inputs.description: Value (in wei) the campaign owner pays for each proof-of-attention.

inputs.name: budget
inputs.description: Total budget (in wei) the campaign owner will deposit  to pay for the proof-of-attention.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.description: Date (in miliseconds) on which the campaign will start to be  avaliable to users.

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.description: Date (in miliseconds) on which the campaign will no longer be avaliable to users.

abiDocs.name: createCampaign
abiDocs.details: Method to create a campaign of user aquisition for a certain application. This method will emit a Campaign Information event with every information  provided in the arguments of this method.

inputs.name: i
inputs.description: number to be converted

abiDocs.name: uintToBytes
abiDocs.notice: Converts a uint256 type variable to a byte32 type variable

inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id to which the query refers

abiDocs.name: getOwnerOfCampaign
abiDocs.details: Based on the Campaign id return the address of the campaign owner
abiDocs.notice: Get the owner of a campaign

inputs.name: packageName
inputs.description: Package name of the application from which the proof of attention refers to.

inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id of the campaign to which the proof of attention is submitted

inputs.name: timestampList
inputs.description: List of 12 timestamps generated 10 seconds apart from each other,  as part of the proof of attention. The timestamp list should be arranged in ascending order

inputs.name: nonces
inputs.description: List of 12 nonces generated during the proof of attention. The index of each  nounce should be acording to the corresponding timestamp index on the timestamp list submitted

inputs.name: appstore
inputs.description: Address of the Appstore receiving part of the proof of attention reward

inputs.name: oem
inputs.description: Address of the OEM receiving part of the proof of attention reward

inputs.name: walletName
inputs.description: Package name of the wallet submitting the proof of attention

inputs.name: countryCode
inputs.description: String with the 2 character identifying the country from which the  proof of attention was processed

abiDocs.name: registerPoA
abiDocs.details: This function verifies the campaign avaliability as well as the validity of  the proof of attention submited. In case any of the verifications fails, the function will  be stopped and an Error event will be emitted with further error information. A PoARegistered event with the same information submited as arguments of this function will  be emmited if the proof of attention is processed correctly. For more information on the proof of attention design refer to the wiki documentation or to  Appcoins Protocol Whitepaper.

inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id to which the query refers

abiDocs.name: isCampaignValid
abiDocs.details: Returns a boolean representing the validity of the campaign Has value of True if the campaign is still valid else has value of False
abiDocs.notice: Check if a certain campaign is still valid

inputs.name: bidId
inputs.description: Campaign id to which the cancelation referes to

abiDocs.name: cancelCampaign
abiDocs.details: When a campaing owner wants to cancel a campaign, the campaign owner needs  to call this function. This function can only be called either by the campaign owner or by  the Advertisement contract owner. This function results in campaign cancelation and  retreival of the remaining budged to the respective campaign owner.
abiDocs.notice: Cancel a campaign and give the remaining budget to the campaign owner

inputs.name: numerator
inputs.description: Numerator part of the division

inputs.name: denominator
inputs.description: Denominator part of the division

abiDocs.notice: Returns the division of two numbers
